questions: What is the grace period for premium payment under the National Parivar Mediclaim Plus Policy?
What is the waiting period for pre-existing diseases (PED) to be covered?
Does this policy cover maternity expenses, and what are the conditions?
What is the waiting period for cataract surgery?
Are the medical expenses for an organ donor covered under this policy?
What is the No Claim Discount (NCD) offered in this policy?
Is there a benefit for preventive health check-ups?
How does the policy define a 'Hospital'?
What is the extent of coverage for AYUSH treatments?
Are there any sub-limits on room rent and ICU charges for Plan A?

answers: Information not available in the provided context.

Expenses related to the treatment of a Pre-Existing Disease (PED) and its direct complications shall be excluded until the expiry of thirty six (36) months of continuous coverage after the date of inception of the first policy. If the Insured Person is continuously covered without any break as defined under the portability norms, then waiting period for the same would be reduced to the extent of prior coverage.

Yes, the policy covers maternity expenses for any female Insured Person aged between 18 and 45 years. Delivery or termination is covered within a waiting period of twenty-four (24) months, unless induced by accident. A maximum of two deliveries or terminations are covered, and only one delivery or termination is covered per policy period. Maternity expenses of a surrogate mother are not covered unless claimed under infertility. Ectopic pregnancy is covered under In-patient treatment, provided it is established by medical reports. Pre-natal and Post-Natal hospitalization expenses are also covered per delivery, including vaccination for the New Born Baby, subject to the limit as shown in the Table of Benefits.
Expenses related to the treatment of Cataract shall be excluded until the expiry of two years of continuous coverage after the date of inception of the first policy.

Yes, the company shall indemnify the Medical Expenses incurred in respect of an organ donor's Hospitalisation during the Policy Period for harvesting of the organ donated to an Insured Person, provided certain conditions are met. The organ donation must conform to the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994, the organ is used for an Insured Person who has been medically advised to undergo an organ transplant, the expenses are for the organ donor as an in-patient, and a claim has been admitted under In-patient Treatment for the Insured Person undergoing the organ transplant. However, exclusions apply to pre-hospitalization/post-hospitalization medical expenses of the donor, costs associated with organ acquisition, experimental/investigational transplants, medical treatment/complications for the donor consequent to harvesting, and expenses related to organ transportation or preservation.

On renewal of policies with a term of one year, a NCD of flat 5% shall be allowed on the base premium, provided claims are not reported in the expiring Policy. On renewal of policies with a term exceeding one year, the NCD amount with respect to each claim free policy year shall be aggregated and allowed on renewal. The aggregate amount of NCD allowed shall not exceed flat 5% of the total base premium for the term of the policy.

Yes, expenses of health check up shall be reimbursed (irrespective of past claims) at the end of a block of two continuous policy years, provided the Policy has been continuously renewed with the Company without a break. Expenses payable are subject to the limit stated in the Table of Benefits.

A 'Hospital' means any institution established for in-patient care and day care treatment of disease/ injuries and which has been registered as a hospital with the local authorities under the Clinical Establishments (Registration and Regulation) Act, 2010 or under the enactments specified under Schedule of Section 56(1) of the said Act, OR complies with all minimum criteria: has qualified nursing staff round the clock; has at least ten inpatient beds (or fifteen in places with population over ten lacs); has a qualified medical practitioner (s) in charge round the clock; and has a fully equipped operation theatre of its own.

The Company shall indemnify Medical Expenses incurred for Inpatient Care treatment under Ayurveda, Yoga and Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha and Homeopathy systems of medicines during each Policy Period up to the limit of Sum Insured as specified in the Policy Schedule in any AYUSH Hospital.

Yes, for Plan A, room charges and intensive care unit charges per day are payable up to the limit shown in the Table of Benefits. However, this limit shall not apply if the treatment is undergone for a listed procedure in a Preferred Provider Network (PPN) as a package. Similarly, for Plan A, the company's liability for cataract surgery is up to the limit shown in the Table of Benefits, which also does not apply if the treatment is for a listed procedure in a PPN as a package.
